title: Noah Lyles questioned the NBA 'world champions' label. Everyone had thoughts
description: When track and field star Noah Lyles questioned why people refer to NBA title winners as "world champions," everyone from Drake to Kevin Durant rushed to have their say.

title: With hold on confirmations, Pentagon says fate of hundreds of officers in limbo
description: Hundreds of nominees for military positions have been stalled as Sen. Tommy Tuberville, R-Ala., protests Pentagon abortion policy. The Pentagon says the total number could swell to 650.

title: 'A Guest in the House' rests on atmosphere, delivering an uncanny, wild ride
description: Though inscrutabilities persist in the plot of Emily Carroll's new adult horror graphic novel, the chilling ambiance makes this book one worth visiting.

title: Samuel Wurzelbacher, who became 'Joe the Plumber' after confronting Obama, dies at 49
description: Wurzelbacher was thrust into the political spotlight after questioning Barack Obama about his economic policies during the 2008 presidential campaign. He had been battling pancreatic cancer.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy picked up steam at the GOP debate. How far could he go?
description: Ramaswamy has pitched himself as a younger, more extreme version of the former president. While he's gained in the polls, a GOP strategist warns "he'll never surpass Trump by trying to mimic Trump."

title: He helped write MLK's 'I Have a Dream' speech. Now he reflects on change in the U.S.
description: 60 years after Martin Luther King Jr. gave his famous "I Have a Dream" speech, we hear from one of the men who helped him write it, his friend and attorney Clarence B. Jones.

title: 'You're not welcome here!' DeSantis booed at vigil for Jacksonville shooting victims
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis visited Jacksonville on Sunday to mourn the three victims killed in a racially motivated shooting at a local Dollar General.

title: Why would Trump's supporters vote for Ramasamy instead of the former president?
description: NPR's A Martinez talks to GOP strategist Dave Carney about Republican presidential contender Vivek Ramaswamy, who has positioned himself as a younger Donald Trump.

title: Tropical Storm Idalia is forecast to become a major hurricane before it hits Florida
description: Forecasters are warning of the possibility of dangerous storm surges caused by Idalia, and Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis has suggested that some residents in coastal areas may have to evacuate.

title: Judge sets March 4, 2024 as Trump trial date in election interference case
description: The judge overseeing a criminal case against former President Donald Trump for interfering with the 2020 presidential election has set a trial date of March 4, 2024.

title: Latest on Ukraine: Wagner chief Prigozhin died as Russia's war turned 1 1/2
description: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Tropical Storm Idalia: Cars may stop working mid-evacuation due to fuel contamination
description: Florida officials reported "potentially widespread" diesel contamination in gasoline in the Tampa area Saturday, raising alarm that car engines and power generators could break as the storm nears.

title: Up First briefing: Trump trial date expected; Jacksonville shooting; Maui surf lessons
description: A federal judge will set a date for Trump's election obstruction case. Crowds mourn three Black people killed at a Dollar General in Florida. Pro surfers give kids in Maui a surf lesson.

title: Alcaraz and Djokovic symbolize the transition in tennis as U.S. Open is set to begin
description: Observers say the sport for both the men's and women's games is changing, leaving parity and opportunities for new ascending champions.

title: As classes resume in sweltering heat, many schools lack air conditioning
description: Amid sweltering heat waves, classes have resumed in many districts around the country that have outdated heating and cooling systems — or no air conditioning at all.

title: Ozempic seems to curb cravings for alcohol. Here's what scientists think is going on
description: People taking weight-loss drugs Ozempic and Wegovy report a dampening of the urge to drink. Here's how the drugs curb cravings and what that could mean for helping treat addiction.

title: Mug shots are usually harmful. For Trump and his supporters, it's a badge of honor
description: Typically, mug shots are associated with shame. But for former president Donald Trump and some of his supporters, his mug shot — the first ever of an American president — was something they embraced.

title: Maui's surf pros paddle out with kids from Lahaina for a healing surf session
description: Families displaced by wildfire get a welcome reprieve as a surf session for kids and families gave them a chance for a normal Saturday.

title: How scientists engineered a see-through squid with its brain in plain view
description: A see-through squid is giving scientists an unprecedented view of the brain and other organs in a living animal.

title: Simone Biles wins a record 8th U.S. gymnastics title a full decade after her first
description: Biles became the oldest woman to win a national title since USA Gymnastics began organizing the event in 1963. Her eight crowns moved her past Alfred Jochim, who won seven between 1925-33.

title: NASCAR driver Ryan Preece is released from the hospital after violent multi-flip crash
description: Preece went to the hospital on Saturday after his Mustang flipped at least 10 times during the final laps of the NASCAR Cup Series race in Daytona Beach, Fla.
